modules.description: Handles RGB color definitions with predefined constants and a constructor for creating custom colors. Works with tuples of integers representing red, green, and blue values. Used to specify and manipulate colors when drawing abstract elements in the library.

Handles 3D scene creation and population using abstract drawable elements. It initializes scenes with specified axis labels and adds individual or grouped drawable elements with associated colors. Useful for visualizing structured 3D abstract data models with color-coded components.

Handles 2D scene creation and manipulation, including camera control through translation and scaling. Works with drawable elements and color associations to render abstract compositions. Use to build visualizations with customizable camera views, grid, and axis settings.

This module creates drawable representations from abstract elements like boxes, octagons, and polyhedra using constructors such as `of_box`, `of_oct`, and `of_pol`. It supports operations like `union` and `product` to combine drawable elements into composite shapes. Use cases include visualizing abstract domains, convex hulls from point lists, and hypercubes defined by variable ranges.

This module provides tools for creating and visualizing abstract 2D and 3D geometric elements. It supports operations such as defining RGB colors, constructing drawable shapes from abstract domains, combining shapes via union and product, and rendering scenes with customizable camera views in both 2D and 3D. Concrete use cases include visualizing convex hulls, hypercubes, and structured 3D data models with color-coded components, with output options including interactive displays and file formats like SVG, OBJ, and LaTeX TikZ.
